channel.title: Does This Feel Right?
channel.description: Thoughts on business, technology, and the human condition.

item.title: The Rise of the Non-Musician
item.description: For centuries, music required dexterity. Now, it only requires taste. We are entering the golden age of the non-musician.

item.title: The New Builders Are 16
item.description: Teenagers aren't just using Google's Antigravity to cheat on homework. They're building products that feel like magic, and they're doing it for fun.

item.title: The Weight of Iteration
item.description: A look behind the curtain at the recent technical overhaul and what this studio project holds for the future.

item.title: The Engine and The Gallery
item.description: Why we are decoupling the signal from the noise, and how Substack powers the studio while the site preserves the art.

item.title: The Extinction of the Modern Man
item.description: Behavioral sciences suggest a radical shift in male archetypes is underway. Are we witnessing an end, or a transformation?

item.title: Why Most Content Feels Like 'People Are Irresponsible'
The Importance of Friendship and Conversation in the AI World
item.description: In the era of the "Perfect Companion," the most radical act is to have a messy, real conversation.

item.title: Social Media is Our "First Contact"
item.description: What happens when AI meets humanity? We're already living it—on Twitter, TikTok, and Instagram.

item.title: How to Scale a Coffee Shop (The Alex Hormozi Way)
item.description: Stop selling commodities. Start selling Offers. A guide to applying the Value Equation to your local cafe.

item.title: There Are Richest Women—But They're Often Overshadowed
item.description: Women make up just 13-15% of billionaires. A data-driven look at why they are less visible in the media.

item.title: Building This Blog with Antigravity: A Meta Reflection
item.description: I built this entire platform in one evening with an AI coding assistant. Here's what I learned about the future

item.title: The Quiet Return of RSS in 2025
item.description: In an age of algorithmic noise, the simple XML feed has become a sanctuary for intentional consumption.
